last_episode_to_air.name: Episode 6
last_episode_to_air.overview: Having completed training, the junior soldiers of 7 Platoon have been commissioned as privates in the British Army and are dispersed across the length and breadth of the country to join their chosen regiments.

name: Raw Recruits: Squaddies at 16
overview: Documentary series following a batch of fresh-faced teenage recruits going through the British Army's basic training.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: Teenagers from across the country begin basic army training.

episodes.name: Break Them Down, Build Them Up
episodes.overview: On the first day the physical demands are high for the new recruits as they are pushed to their limits by mandatory fitness assessments. They are also taught how to correctly strip down a rifle and how to use a gas mask.

episodes.name: Episode #1.2
episodes.overview: The rookies of 19 Platoon continue their Phase 1 training travelling to Catterick, North Yorkshire to spend 3 days and 2 nights out on field exercises that will test their stamina and endurance. There is excitement ahead of Families Day.

episodes.name: Episode #1.3
episodes.overview: The rookies confront the realities of soldiering and the difficult truths associated with it - that they will be asked to put their own lives at risk and potentially have to take the lives of others.

episodes.name: Do or Die
episodes.overview: The members of 19 Platoon enter the final, month-long phase of their training. They head to Otterburn in Northumberland to put to the test everything they have learned. Who will make it to the passing-out parade?

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.overview: Another group of teenage recruits go through basic Army training in Harrogate. Rookies Vyse and Johnson grapple with the reality of not seeing their families for 6 weeks and the boys get in trouble during a room inspection.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.overview: The members of 7 Platoon must all pass their first live exercise, which means firing a weapon. Allegations of bullying means one junior soldier faces expulsion while another tearful recruit wants to leave.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.overview: The platoon travel to Normandy to visit the graves of 4,000 soldiers, leading some to confirm their commitment to serving their country, while others question their future.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.overview: For the first time 7 Platoon use live ammunition as they are trained to kill using bullets and bayonets then undergo their toughest physical test to date. Turner is punished for smoking and Fishwick is placed in specialist rehabilitation.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.overview: The recruits face a fortnight of tactical exercises for their final stage of training before Graduation Day arrives. But will all the junior soldiers graduate to their chosen regiment?

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.overview: Having completed training, the junior soldiers of 7 Platoon have been commissioned as privates in the British Army and are dispersed across the length and breadth of the country to join their chosen regiments.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview: Teenagers from across the country begin basic army training.
